column4: My sound has started to act up when playing with Firefox (flash) or an audio-player. But not with mplayer.
I only have one soundcard.
gutsy?
are you using alsa directly?
I think so.
does closing all other audio apps before starting Firefox to view a Flash applet work?
are you referring to quality-wise?
what level is PCM set to?
No idea, where do i check that?
using any mixer utility, e.g., amixer, alsamixer, aumix, the speaker icon in the upper right corner of the top panel in GNOME, ...
The sound level is 100% percent, if thats what  you were meaning.
too high.  Try decreasing it to < 50%.
Wow, that worked. Thanks alot
then you'll need to use the update-fonts* utilities.
drop it into ~/.fonts/, run `sudo fc-cache -f -v` in a terminal, then close and reopen whichever font selector.
so the question is about configuring wireless on your Ubuntu install?  Which Ubuntu release?
I tried what you told me (the font thing), but it doesn't work. I have the font in both .pcf and .fon-format, neither shows up.
that's for TrueType format.
So.. is there any solution?
do you have the font in TT format?
No, i have it in .fon and .pcf. It wasn't available in ttf.
see their respective man pages
